title: Business Live: US stocks fall as NK tensions build - BBC News
summary: ftse 100 dragged down by ex-dividend stocks .
lego boss departs after eight months .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's all for tonight from the business live page .
please join us again from 06:00 .

documents.title: us stocks close down after escalating north korea and us tensions
text: us indexes closed lower as investors continued to fret over escalating tensions between the us and north korea .
president donald trump on thursday escalated his rhetoric on north korea , saying his `` fire and fury '' comment might not be `` tough enough . ''
`` maybe that statement was n't tough enough , '' trump told reporters as he prepared to meet with top national security advisers .
`` if anything , that statement may not be tough enough . ''

his comments came after north korea said it was completing plans to fire four intermediate-range missiles over japan to land near the us pacific island territory of guam , in an unusually detailed threat .
the dow jones industrial average was down 0.9 % at 21,844.01 and the s & p 500 was down 1.5 % at 2,438.21 .
the nasdaq composite lost 2.1 % to 6,216.87 .

documents.title: tech entrepreneurs on acid
text: a fascinating piece in the ft digs into a san francisco fashion among entrepreneurs for taking microdoses of lsd .
at a small dose , the illegal hallucinogen stimulates the mind , rather than causing a full-blown acid trip , the entrepreneurs claim .
they take it as an alternative to coffee as a bit of a apparently .
and it certainly seems to explain some of the impenetrable , jargon-heavy press statements issued by silicon valley firms , too .

documents.title: kylie jenner 's make-up brand could be worth $ 1bn by 2022 , says her mum
text: she may be only 20 , but kylie jenner may soon have a beauty business worth more than a billion dollars .
for the first time , the youngest kardashian-jenner has revealed how much money her kylie cosmetics brand makes .
in an interview with wwd , kylie and her mum kris jenner revealed she 's made $ 420m ( £ 323m ) in retail sales in 18 months .
her cosmetics brand has outsold established companies like bobbi brown and lancome .
read more here .

documents.title: 'our addiction to economic growth is killing us '
text: our addiction to economic growth is killing us '' - anthropologist @ twitterid with our latest # viewsnight
at last someone talking common sense - but people in influential postions will still ignore
wow .
thank you for articulating this so clearly .
i would love to talk to you about challenging this as a local cllr .
just says it all .
very strongly and correctly .
great video , thanks for spreading the message to the mainstream .
i do n't have an addiction to economic growth .
but i do have an addiction to a resource based economy .
one of the main problems with humans ( imho ) is they think the earth is 'theirs ' .
pretty much bang on .
true , but it wont win any elections .
no elections on dead planet .
planned de-growth may throw a few people .
perhaps 'reprioritisation for survival ' is more accurate ?
look at a list of countries by gdp per capita and tell me which ones are the nicest to live in
agree
economist/ecologist one sees earth as an infinite resource the other sees it as mother .
which one are you ?
that 's only part of the problem !
the main problem is out of control population growth .
more people equals more pollution !
totally agree .
i think the inability for those born without 'looks ' makes them chase money
# shelvegdp # cutdownonwaste

documents.title: investors 'want soundcloud founder to be replaced as chief exec '
text: investors in troubled soundcloud want to replace its chief executive as part of a new funding deal , according to tech publication recode .
kerry trainor , the former chief executive of video-sharong website vimeo , would run soundcloud instead of founder alex ljung ( left ) , who would chair the company 's board , recode says .

documents.title: trump says maybe nk statements have n't been tough enough
text: us president donald trump has said that perhaps his statements on north korea have n't been tough enough , according to reports .
north korea should be `` very , very nervous '' if it does anything to the us , mr trump reportedly said .
global markets have been on the wane due to escalating tensions between the us and north korea .

documents.title: 'twenty tonnes of insecticide-tainted eggs sold in denmark '
text: twenty tonnes of insecticide-tainted eggs sold in denmark , says food safety authority
a spokesman a me e benedict said all resources have been scrambled
that 's a cracking reply .
i heard they would all be gone by frieday
or poached
eggs akimbo
that is never good ! !
that 's why i 'm vegan
me too : )
maybe that insecticide is the cure to stupidity , and we throw it away ?
another great reason for buying local produce ! ! ! !
# how equipped is ug infrastructure to handle this challenge .
# is the c'try ready .
thank
buy local and eat fresh , supermarkets are about profits not health care , bse , horse meat scandal , now this pesticides in eggs
omg
what

documents.title: mueller 's legal team 'overmatches trump's '
text: us president donald trump does n't yet have enough legal firepower behind him to deal with special counsel robert mueller 's russia probe , bloomberg businessweek reports .
mr trump 's lawyers are competent , but there are n't yet enough of them to deal with mr mueller , the article says .

documents.title: uber exec to step down
text: ride-hailing firm uber 's head of operations , ryan graves , a long-time ally of former chief executive travis kalanick , is stepping down from his full-time job , cnbc reports .
mr graves will , however , continue to serve on uber 's board , it said .

documents.title: akzo nobel wins again in court battle with hedge fund elliott
text: dulux-owner akzo nobel does n't have to let shareholders vote on whether to dismiss its chairman , a dutch court has ruled .
it 's another victory for the paint company against activist investor elliott advisors , which is akzo 's largest shareholder .

the activist investor , which has a 9.5 % stake , holds chairman antony burgmans responsible for akzo 's rejection of a 26bn euro ( £ 23.56bn ) takeover proposal from us rival ppg industries earlier this year and wants him dismissed .

documents.title: can facebook 's new video channel challenge netflix ?
text: the social media giant 's watch service will offer shows ranging from comedy to sports .
it could signal a shift from facebook being a technology company to a media firm , as we hear from mark scott , the chief technology correspondent at politico .

documents.title: fsa : 'people deserve food they can trust '
text: the food standards agency ( fsa ) , which is investigating the importation of around 700,000 eggs from potentially contaminated dutch farms , has told 5 live why it decided to withdraw some products from supermarkets despite saying the risk to health was `` very unlikely '' .

steve wearne , director of policy at the fsa , said : `` we think people deserve food they can trust and part of that is not having to eat food that 's got chemicals in it that are n't authorised , and that 's the case with this .
it 's not supposed to be in food . ''
eleven products containing egg - including sandwiches and salads - have been withdrawn from supermarkets .
asda , waitrose , sainsburys and morrisons are affected .
mr wearne added : `` we 've been working closely with uk industry to trace eggs up and down the food chain and that 's helped us to come to this new figure : 700,000 .
`` it is a small proportion of the 10 billion eggs we eat in the uk each year . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: off the menu
text: shares in blue apron , the us meal kit delivery company , have sunk 13 % in new york today following its first results as a public company .

no prizes for guessing why they were n't appetising : despite a rise in the number of active customers to 943,000 , they are spending less on orders amid stiff competition from the likes of hello fresh and amazon .
costs also soared and the company reported a net loss of $ 31.6m ( £ 24.3m ) .
blue apron only listed in late june , but its shares have since fallen 45 % to $ 5.42 .
ouch .
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter, BBC News

documents.title: us 'to use reagan-era trade weapon '
text: the us risks using a dud in bringing back a 1980s era trade weapon , bloomberg politics reports .
it 's weighing up an investigation into alleged chinese intellectual property infringement using section 301 of the 1974 trade act .
but that was only successfully used in retaliatory action twice , bloomberg says .
the us has had a far better hit-rate under wto arbitration , it adds .
besides , china has levers it can pull if a trade war erupts , including targeting imports of soya beans from the us , which exceeded $ 14bn ( £ 11bn ) last year .

documents.title: sterling touches three week low against the dollar
text: sterling touched a three-week low against the dollar as a mixed bag of output and trade data did little to boost investor enthusiasm for an economy struggling to meet bank of england targets .
the pound fell by as much as a third of a percent in early trade to as low as $ 1.2952 before recovering some ground after industrial production numbers just beat analyst forecasts .
it 's trading about 0.1 % down at $ 1.2989 .
construction output was weaker than expected and other data showed the uk 's external trade gap expanded further despite the weakening of the pound over the past year .

documents.title: north korea tensions take dow back down below 22,000 points
text: the dow jones industrial average has been above 22,000 points since the beginning of august - but today is back down below that .

investors are concerned about escalating tensions between the us and north korea , which has said it is finalising plans to fire four intermediate-range missiles over japan to land near the us territory of guam .

documents.title: talktalk fined £ 100,000 for inadequate data security
text: communications firm talktalk has been fined £ 100,000 by the uk data protection watchdog for leaving customers open to scams .
talktalk gave too much access to customer data to it services firm wipro , the information commissioner 's office said .

`` a specialist investigation by talktalk identified three wipro accounts that had been used to gain unauthorised and unlawful access to the personal data of up to 21,000 customers , '' the ico said .

documents.title: dow slips 100 points as tensions with north korea escalate
text: the dow jones industrial average is down more than 100 points as investors fret over escalating tensions between the us and north korea .
north korea has outlined details for a missile strike near the us territory of guam , adding fuel to rising tensions with the us .
the s & p 500 is down more than 20 points , and the nasdaq is down about 70 points .

documents.title: paypal to buy online lending firm swift financial
text: paypal is to buy online lending company swift financial in a bid to expand its business that provides capital to merchants .
the acquisition will mean paypal can offer loans to larger businesses that use it to process payments , and provide credit to firms that do n't use its services , the company said .

documents.title: look for british lion eggs , says industry body
text: the british egg information service has this to say about the fipronil scare :

`` british egg producers have reiterated the need for consumers and food producers to look for british lion eggs and egg products , following the food standards agency ( fsa ) announcement that some processed foods are being withdrawn from sale as they may have been made with non-uk eggs contaminated with fipronil
`` shell eggs on sale to consumers are not affected and the food standards agency says that there is no need for people to change the way they consume or cook eggs .
`` all major uk retailers stock british lion shell eggs and tests have shown that there is no risk from british eggs
`` food manufacturers , retailers and caterers using processed egg should look for egg products produced within the british lion egg products scheme . ''

documents.title: how many dutch eggs affected by food scare ?
text: the food standards agency said the number of eggs that came to the uk that may have been exposed to fipronil insecticide is `` closer to 700,000 than the 21,000 we previously believed had been imported . ''

`` however , as this represents 0.007 % of the eggs we consume in the uk every year , it remains the case that it is very unlikely that there is any risk to public health from consuming these foods , '' it said .
as previously mentioned , supermarkets have pulled some products from the shelves as a precaution .

documents.title: egg products off the shelves after contamination scare
text: the food standards agency has said a number of products have been withdrawn from supermarket shelves after a dutch egg contamination scare .
some eggs may have been exposed to an insecticide called fipronil , which can potentially harm people 's kidneys , liver and thyroid glands .
the eggs then may have got into the uk food chain .

the agency said : `` it is very unlikely that these eggs pose a risk to public health , but as fipronil is unauthorised for use in food-producing animals we have acted with urgency to ensure that consumers are protected . ''
the list of products is :
the latest use by date on these potentially affected products is 16 august .
most have a limited shelf life .

documents.title: economic growth softens
text: british economic growth has softened again following a modest improvement in the second quarter , according to the national institute of economic and social research .
`` the service sector , which was the main driver for economic growth in the second quarter , appears to have slowed , '' said amit kara , head of uk macroeconomic forecasting at niesr .

`` we see a modest recovery in the second half of this year in response to strengthening global growth and a weaker currency , but on the flip side , consumer spending is likely to be weighed down by weak wage growth and investment spending held back by brexit-related uncertainty . ''
earlier today , official data from ons showed that uk industrial production shrank in the second quarter of the year .

documents.title: cineworld to make a splash with 4dx technology
text: cineworld is upgrading its flagship cinemas at london 's 02 and the empire at leicester square to introduce 4dx technology .
it will give film fans rocking seats and see them sprayed with water from their chairs .
it has also revealed plans to open 11 more sites in the uk , including its first cinema in leeds .
its pre-tax profit for the last six months climbed 57.5 % to £ 48.2million .
the chain is expecting a bumper second half too on the back of upcoming films such as paddington 2 and star wars : episode viii : the last jedi .

documents.title: aldermore continues its challenge
text: challenger bank aldermore has reported a 32 % rise in profit for the first half of the year .
the news helped its share price climb 2.85 % to 227.20p .
the bank , which was founded in 2009 by a former barclays executive to lend to small and medium-sized businesses , said net loans to customers rose 8.4 % to £ 8.11billion .
total customer deposits also grew more than 10 % to £ 7.3billion .
aldermore 's profit before tax climbed to £ 78million in the six months ending injune 30 , from £ 59million a year earlier .

documents.title: facebook is a media company
text: today 's news that facebook is launching a a new video service confirms that it is a media company , reckons bbc media editor amol rajan , who 's been tweeting about it
1/ today is the day that zuck finally abandons any pretence that @ twitterid is n't a media company .
a decisive shift into original content
2/ with facebook watch shows that one of zuck 's many ambitions is the reinvention of broadcasting .
the key idea is n't particularly new - a
3/ a properly socially curated viewing experience , in which your social network both promotes and distributes content .
yet another nail
4/ in the as yet un-filled coffin of those old-fashioned things , editors and commissioners , those vips who determine what makes up
5/ that curious thing called the public domain .
facebook watch does accelerate the shift in power ( democratisation if you like ) to users
6/ but i tell you what else it does - with @ twitterid keeping 55 % of revs it accelerates their total control of the universe too , with only
7/ those other tech giants for company .
disney 's move into direct relationships with consumers , and now this from facebook , shows just
8/ how ludicrously fast the media landscape is changing .
exciting times for audiences .
v v challenging times for old skool institutions .

first westmonster interactive livestream got 100k views , doing another today , loving it :
i 'm not sure it 's a good thing though what 's your thoughts on this being a rather negative , dangerous thing ?

documents.title: greggs ' broker boost
text: shares in baker greggs have climbed 4.66 % today - a rise of 52 points - after it was been given the thumbs up by german investment bank berenberg .
analyst ned hammond said : `` after seeing the company present twice we feel increasingly confident that it can continue to achieve underlying growth above the market level . ''
the bakery chain is targeting net cash of £ 40million by the end of the year , although it has said that if it rises significantly above this , it will return capital to shareholders .
mr hammond thinks that is very likely .

documents.title: got a minute or two bbc business presenter ben thompson plugs today 's show . it 's worth a watch
text: today 's show was busier than ever .
# toshiba , # facebook , # lego , # trump , # snap .
# fox & psy-ops it 's online here :
looking uber cute though ( both of you naturally )
why do presenters always hold a quire of papers that they never look at ?
didnt see it .
i was asleep !

documents.title: ftse slide continues
text: the ftse 100 has continued to slide today .
it 's down 92.87 points , 1.24 % , which points to more than the drag of some key company shares going ex-dividend .
saying that four out of the five biggest losers are ex-dividend , the exception being intercontinental hotels , which has slipped 2.64 % .
across the winder indices , the biggest loser is leicestershire brick-maker ibstock , down 5.24 % to 234.90p .
this morning it revealed that pre-tax profits for the last six months climbed almost 3 % to nearly £ 39million .

documents.title: is the pru planning to sell-off its uk business ?
text: analysts think that today 's merger of fund manager m & g with the prudential 's insurance division could be the first step to a sale

`` the combined business would bear a remarkable resemblance to several other uk life businesses , and the success of the dc pension scheme focused prufund would seem to provide a model for a viable standalone future .
there 's no need to get rid of the uk business , but today 's move would make it a lot simpler . ''

`` selling the uk business is something the company has been mulling over in private , and cutting loose the underperforming domestic operations , where pru no longer writes new annuity business , could stick a rocket under the share price .
news that the m & g asset management business will merge with its prudential uk & europe life insurance operation adds fuel to the fire that this is preparation for an eventual sale . ''

documents.title: live and loud
text: despite the rise of streaming , most music acts now rely on performing live to make money - which is also helping companies such as live nation .
the world 's biggest concert promoter sold 68 million tickets in the six months to july - 22 % higher than the same period last year .
that produced a 28 % rise in revenue for the concerts division to $ 3.1bn .
chief executive michael rapino said 2017 is `` on track to be another year of growth and record results '' for live nation , which also owns ticketmaster .

its new verified fan product , launched earlier this year , had sold more than 1 million tickets for 50 artists in the us and europe to `` true fans , with a dramatic reduction in these tickets then being sold on secondary sites '' , he added .
investors liked the numbers , sending live nation shares up 7 % to $ 40.25 in after-hours trading in new york .
the stock has risen more than 40 % this year .
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter, BBC News

documents.title: overseas boost for savills
text: estate agency group savills pushed up pre-tax profit by 27 % to £ 32.4m in the first half of the year despite a slowdown in the uk .
in fact the boost came from asia and its real estate management arm : savills gets nearly two-thirds of its revenue outside the uk .
fee income from uk residential sales fell by 4 % , with the number of transactions lower than a year earlier when trading had been lifted ahead of changes to stamp duty in april 2016 .

for the uk , it said : `` increased levels of political and economic uncertainty created by the general election and the ongoing negotiations to leave the eu make it difficult to predict market volumes for the rest of the year . ''

documents.title: uk stuck with 'sluggish growth '
text: the latest trade and industrial output data suggests the uk economy had a poor end to the second quarter of the year , according to howard archer , chief economic adviser to the ey item club .
june 's official output data for industry and construction did nothing to change the impression of an economy stuck in a pattern of sluggish growth '' , he says .
he notes that the `` buoyancy of manufacturing surveys continues to be at odds with the weakness of the official numbers '' .
`` with sterling 's deprecation and a healthy world economy supporting exporters , one would hope that the gap between the two will narrow in a favourable direction . ''
however , he says the latest trade figures , which saw june 's trade deficit nearly double from the month before , suggest there is little sign of this happening .
`` evidence of rebalancing , at least in the 'hard ' data , remains absent , '' he says .

documents.title: pru to merge m & g with insurance divisions
text: prudential says it will merge its uk asset management business m & g with its uk and european insurance divisions .
the move comes as fund managers face increasing pressure on charges and competition from low-cost tracker funds .
`` combining these businesses will allow us to better leverage our considerable scale and capabilities , '' said chief executive mike wells .
the combined business will manage £ 332bn in assets for more than six million customers , prudential said .
prudential 's operating profit climbed to £ 2.36bn in the first half , boosted by growth in asia .

documents.title: uk trade deficit widens
text: the uk 's trade deficit in goods and services widened by £ 2bn between may and june to £ 4.6bn , according to the office for national statistics .
it said this was mainly due to an increase in imports of £ 1.7bn .
in the second quarter of the year , the trade deficit widened by £ 0.1bn to £ 8.9bn as imports and exports grew at about the same rate .

documents.title: traces of meat in british banknotes to continuebbc personal finance correspondent simon gompertz tweets
text: bank of england says has decided polymer banknotes will continue to have traces of animal products
bank says there were cost considerations to abandoning animal tallow in banknotes and main alternative , palm oil , signif environmental probs

documents.title: output and manufacturing figures paint depressing
text: industrial output in britain unexpectedly up by 0.5 % in june , according to official figures published by ons today .
but that simply reflected a lack of seasonal oilfield maintenance in the month , which normally depresses output and instead is likely to come later in the year , ons warned .
more worryingly , car production dropped by 3.6 % in june after a 2.3 % decline the previous month .
that 's the sharpest fall since december 2013 .
overall manufacturing , which includes car production but not oil , was flat on the month .
construction , which accounts for 6 % of the economy , fell by 0.1 % in june and dropped by 1.3 percent in the second quarter as a whole - the sharpest drop in almost five years .

documents.title: mortgage arrears and possessions fall again
text: the number of mortgages in arrears of 2.5 % or more of the outstanding balance fell to 88,200 in the second quarter of this year .
that 's the lowest level since at least 1994 , according to uk finance , when the data was first tracked .
the number of properties repossessed also fell , from 1,900 to 1,800 , which accounts for 0.02 % of all mortgages , the trade body pointed out .
the total was the same as in the final quarter of last year , and is the lowest figure since quarterly data was first published in 2008 , it said .
`` borrowers are being helped by low interest rates , '' pointed out uk finance head of mortgages paul smee .

documents.title: lack of housing supply dragging down property market
text: more comment on that downbeat rics housing survey which suggest that the slowdown is spreading outside london to the south east

`` the long-running issue of housing supply remains , and it 's vital that the government continues to find and act on ways to address our limited housing stock to boost housing supply and give more younger buyers a better chance at homeownership . ''
`` the fundamental issue which remains and prevents a significant advancement in our housing market is a chronic lack of supply .

the government must begin to put words into action and address this problem , sooner rather than later , to enable more first-time buyers to step onto the property ladder and increase market fluidity . ''

documents.title: coca-cola hbc fizzes up
text: coca-cola hbc , one of the coca-cola company 's largest bottlers , proved the ftse 100 's biggest climber this morning after it posted solid first-half growth figures .
the firm said net sales revenue per unit case was 4.2 % higher year-on-year for the six months to 30 june .
the company made an operating profit of €266.4million ( £ 241m ) , up 20.8 % on the same time last year .

`` we are on track for broad-based revenue and margin growth for the full year with the organisation energised by the progress we are making towards our 2020 financial targets , '' said boss dimitris lois .

documents.title: wanda hotel shares jump on restructure plans
text: shares in wanda hotel , a hong kong-listed arm of chinese conglomerate dalian wanda , surged more than 20 % thursday after announcing plans to take over the group 's theme park business .
the hang seng nevertheless closed slightly lower , as did many of the region 's indexes , as investors worried about tensions between the us and north korea .
south korea 's kospi slumped 0.4 % to a seven-week low , while the won currency fell to its weakest position in a month .
singapore 's straits times index was the lone exception , pushed 0.8 % higher by financials and industrial stocks .

documents.title: ex-dividend firms drag down ftse 100
text: a number of ftse 100 firms have gone ex-dividend today which has been a drag on the blue-chip index .
the three biggest fallers this morning have all gone ex-dividend today which accounts for the 3.10 % fall of bt group , the 2.14 % drop by anglo american , and the 1.89 % slip by diageo .

documents.title: glencore backs electric vehicles
text: mining and commodities group glencore reckons the key to its future success could be electric vehicles .
it said it expected the increased take-up of electric vehicles and demand for storage to boost demand for its products .

glencore chief executive ivan glasenberg said : `` the potential large-scale roll-out of electric vehicles and energy storage systems looks set to unlock material new sources of demand for enabling underlying commodities , including copper , cobalt , zinc and nickel . ''
it said first-half earnings climbed 68 % , while net debt fell $ 1.6billion ( £ 1.2bn ) from the end of 2016 to $ 13.9billion ( £ 10.7bn ) .

documents.title: ftse 100 continues slump
text: the ftse 100 slumped 51.68 points to 7446.38 in early trading .
the biggest losers includes bt group , down 3.06 % , anglo american -2.79 % , and rio tinto , dropping 2.20 % .
on the other hand , coca-cola hbc fizzed up 8.39 % to be the index 's biggest winner after it delivered solid first-half earnings .

documents.title: tui eyes tunisia return
text: thomson owner tui group increased its sales targets for the year after saying holiday demand was `` resilient '' and revealed it is eyeing a return to tunisia .

the german company , like other holiday firms , has been coping with a shift in demand from destinations in the eastern mediterranean and north africa , such as turkey , tunisia and egypt , to countries such as spain and portugal over security fears and political tensions .
but this morning it said demand from british customers had stabilised and it would be looking at adding tunisia back to its programme - shoudl demand be high enough .
third-quarter underlying earnings were 221.6million euros ( £ 200m ) .
we believe that this is testament to the popularity of our holidays and to the high level of priority our customers place on them , '' said chief executive fritz joussen .

documents.title: blockbusters boost cineworld
text: cineworld said half-year revenue rose 17.8 % , as the chain was boosted by the strong box office performance of blockbuster movies such as `` beauty and the beast '' , `` guardians of the galaxy vol .
2 '' and `` the fate of the furious '' .
box office revenue grew 17.7 % to £ 267.2million for the six months to the end of june , while admissions rose 10 % to 50.7million .
cineworld operates 2,136 movie screens .

documents.title: toshiba releases earnings , avoids delisting
text: toshiba has avoided being delisted from the tokyo stock exchange , finally meeting a deadline to report its long-awaited earnings results .
as expected , the results were dismal .
the firm posted a massive loss of $ 8.8bn ( £ 6.7bn ) for the last fiscal year .
toshiba had delayed the release of its financial results for months , as it struggled to secure sign-off on its results from its auditors .
although the firm now has the sign off and is safe from delisting for now , it still faces tough times as it tries to sell-off its lucrative chip unit to cover its losses .

documents.title: facebook coincidence ? the bbc 's technology correspondent spots a coincidence
text: facebook introduces new video service - on the very day rival snap unveils its latest results
what a coincidence .
oh .
wait

documents.title: 'weaker trading ' hits dfs furniture
text: furniture retailer dfs has warned its full-year earnings will be at the lower end of expectations after seeing revenues fall in the second half of its financial year .
it said revenues had been weaker than expected because of `` significant declines in store footfall and customer orders across april , may and june '' .
`` we believe this to be an industry-wide issue , resulting from the uncertain economic environment and unexpected general election , exacerbated by warm weather in may and june , '' it said .
group revenues were down 4 % in the second half of the year , and dfs now expects underlying earnings to be at the low end of its previous forecast of £ 82m-£ 87m .

documents.title: new lego boss after just eight months
text: toy brick maker lego is to appoint its second boss this year .
brit bali padda , 61 , has been pushed aside by the danish company after just eight months in the hot seat to be replaced by a younger man .
the new chief will be 51-year-old niels b christiansen who will take over from 1 october , when mr padda `` will assume a special advisory role with lego brand group '' , the company said .
mr padda has been with the company for 15 years .
mr christiansen is a former mckinsey management consulant and was most recently chief executive of danfoss , a danish technology company .
lego last year increased sales to a record dkr37.9bn ( £ 4.61bn ) .

documents.title: co-op bank cuts losses
text: losses at the co-operative bank narrowed to £ 135.2million for the six months , it has reported .
it continued to lose current account customers with another 25,000 fleeing the bank since december 2016 to leave the co-op with 1.4million accounts .
in june the bank announced plans to raise finance of £ 700m to meet its capital regulatory requiements .
`` the capital raising proposal we announced in june is progressing to plan and is currently on track to conclude by september , '' said liam coleman , chief executive .
he added that business performance in the first half `` has been resilient '' .

documents.title: worrying signs for the economy
text: house prices are barely moving as price growth is slowing , according to the royal institution of chartered surveyors .
but worryingly the number of transactions are down , simon rubinsohn , chief economist at rics , told the today programme .
`` transaction activity has wider implications for the wider economy , '' he said .
`` it affects consumer spending , but perhaps more importantly it affects job mobility and people 's ability to move around the country to take up new roles .
`` it has impact on downsizing and one of the big issues is about people staying in big properties for too long . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: ftse to drop again today ?
text: reuters reports that financial spreadbetters reckon that the ftse 100 will open down 45 points today .
it slumped 44.67 points yesterday to 7498.06 after fears rumbled on all day about donald trump 's `` fire and fury '' statement about north korea .
security group g4s was the worst performer yesterday falling 7.47 % after chief executive ashley almanza said it would sell off more underperforming assets this year .

documents.title: positive prospects for glencore
text: looking ahead to results from mining group glencore this morning , sue noffke , head of prime uk equity team at schroders , told the today programme that there 's been a big rally in commodity stocks recently .
`` that has underpinned a financial recovery in profits , cashfow and balance sheet , '' she said .
glencore yesterday revealed that it has secured the first mining leases for its $ 7billion ( £ 5.4bn ) wandoan coal project in australia 's surat basin , after applying for them 10 years ago .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: facebook to introduce new video service
text: facebook is hoping to capitalise on its two billion users as it makes a move into the crowded market for online video .
users will soon see a new watch tab that will offer a range of shows , some of which have been funded by the social network

like many of facebook 's services , information on users personal tastes will play a role in determining what content they see , and viewers will also be able to see comments and connect dedicated groups for shows .
the move will bring facebook into direct competition with traditional tv networks and video streaming services like netflix and youtube .

documents.title: housing slowdown spreads from london
text: a slowdown in the housing market is spreading from london to other parts of the south east of england , according to the royal institution of chartered surveyors ( rics ) .

simon rubinsohn , chief economist at rics , said : `` sales activity in the housing market has been slipping in the recent months and the most worrying aspect of the latest survey is the suggestion that this could continue for some time to come .
`` one reason for this is the recent series of tax changes but this is only part of the story .
lack of new build in the wake of the financial crisis is a more fundamental factor weighing on the market .
and there are some very real consequences for the economy from all of this including the impact on the ability of people to be mobile when looking for work . ''
more here

documents.title: zurich beats estimates
text: zurich insurance has posted a 21 % rise in second-quarter net earnings .
the swiss insurer set out a turnaround plan last year and is already reaping the rewards .
net profit for for the three months to the end of june climbed to $ 896million ( £ 690m ) , that beat the average analyst estimate of $ 790m ( £ 608m ) .
`` i am very pleased to report results that show what dedicated people can accomplish in a relatively short time , '' chief executive mario greco said .

documents.title: a day of recovery ?
text: tokyo stocks were flat this morning after a sell off the previous day sparked by fears over us-north korea tensions .
global markets tumbled yesterday after donald trump and north korean leader kim jong-un increased their confrontational rhetoric .

trump had stunned the world on tuesday by saying that north korea faced `` fire and fury like the world has never seen '' and north korea revealed plans to launch missiles towards the us pacific territory of guam .
but us secretary of state rex tillerson reassured , saying : `` i think americans should sleep well at night , have no concerns about this particular rhetoric of the last few days . ''
tokyo 's benchmark nikkei 225 index was flat , slipping 0.01 % , or 1.99 points , to 19,736.72 .

documents.title: good morning
text: good morning and welcome to thursday 's business live .

we have a packed day of interim results to look forward to inclduing figures from aldermore , amec , capital & regional , cineworld , coca-cola hbc , derwent london , glencore , pagegroup , prudential .
there will also be trading updates from card factory and dfs and , at 9.30am , manufacturing and trade data from the ons will be published .
